alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 06 at 8:45AM MDT until October 07 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...FROST ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Cloud cover kept temperatures in the middle to upper 30s for most locations, and temperatures are now warming, so the Frost Advisory is now cancelled. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 28 are possible. * WHERE...Northeast Johnson County, Southeast Johnson County and Natrona County Lower Elevations. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freeze products are issued until a season ending event occurs, usually as a result of a hard freeze (28 degrees). Should a season ending event occur, a Freeze Watch/Warning is no longer issued for the season.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Natrona County Lower Elevations; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
